lines.text: Who'll give me a half a dollar for my hand?
Uh, I wouldn't give you a nickel for your whole body.
Well, faint heart never won fair lady... or fat turkey.
Say, is that my tie?
Why, uh... when I got up this morning, I sort of...
Yeah, well, why didn't put on that new checkered suit of mine while you were about it?

[chuckling]
Heh-heh-heh... It didn't fit.

[inquiring at cigar stand]
Say, uh, what are those things for?
Poker dice.
Oh, you gamble with them?
Yes, sir, it's a dollar if you lose, and if you win, you get $2 worth of merchandise.

[looking at her laciviously]
Anything behind the counter?

[coyly]
Anything in merchandise.
Heh, heh, well, you're a cute little package.
[he chuckles]

[throwing Sport out of the game]
Come on! Breeze, and as you go out, take the welcome sign off.

[leaving the poker game a winner]
Suntan, my hat, my cane, and my gloves. I heard that in a play once.
[buttoning and tipping him]
Oh, here. Go with that as far as it'll take yuh.
Thank you, suh.

[to Sleepy Sam]
Well, Nick the Barber gave you a trimmin', hunh? Well, I'll be seein' you boys!
If you were the D.A., how would you tackle him?
I'd shoot him some night when he was trying to escape from the law.
lines.character: Sleepy Sam, earlier mistaken for Hickory Short

lines.text: Don't be silly! Thaat isn't done!
Well, you know his weakness, don't you?
lines.character: Sleepy Sam, earlier mistaken for Hickory Short

lines.text: What?
Heh, he's nuts for blondes. Yeah, send your wife around.
lines.character: Sleepy Sam, earlier mistaken for Hickory Short

lines.text: [as he exits the door]
He'll go for any old bag!
lines.character: Sleepy Sam, earlier mistaken for Hickory Short
